APIs, Products, and API Products

Outline (APIs, Products, and API Products)

  1. Introduction [2]
  2. APIs, Products, and API Products [4]
  3. Network Effect [5]
  4. API Product Management [4]

APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(6) What is an API?

  • An API is a digitally accessible capability
  • An API is designed with users and reuse in mind
  • An API creates value when it is consumed by users


APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(7) What is a Product?



APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(8) What is a Good API? Useful ≫ Findable ≫ Usable

  1. Useful means that it addresses customers' Jobs to Be Done [https://hbr.org/2016/09/know-your-customers-jobs-to-be-done]
  2. Findable means that potential consumers have a fighting chance of finding it
  3. Usable means that the product makes it easy to get their jobs done


APIs, Products, and API Products Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(9) API Consumers

  • APIs produce when value (only) when are being used
    • External APIs allow to interface with partners or the public
    • Internal APIs use private digital building blocks
  • Start looking at APIs from a consumer point of view
    • Private APIs mostly revolve around decoupling internal teams
    • Partner APIs are driven by your ecosystem of business partners
    • Public APIs are intended to attract as many consumers as possible


Network Effect

(11) APIs Need Critical Mass



Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(12) Size Matters: The Network Effect



Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(13) Why? The Network Effects Needs a Network

  • It's ineffective to do digital transformation light
  • ROI grows more than linear because options grow more than linear
  • Find lighthouse projects to demonstrate ROI and potential


Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(14) What? The Platform is a Team Effort

  • Everybody consumes and contributes building blocks
  • Nobody assumes that their product cannot be reused or improved
  • Making APIs the Default [http://dret.net/lectures/api-world-2021/] is effective but not always possible


Network Effect Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(15) How? Collaboration Needs Design and Discipline

  • API products are essential as digital building blocks
  • API product thinking is important for designing good building blocks
  • Everybody is building for everybody else

API Product Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(17) Business APIs

  • APIs representing well-defined business capabilities
  • APIs designed and developed as digital building blocks
  • The API platform is about digital business and not about IT management


API Product Management Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners

(22) There's no API Magic

  • API value is a question of re-imagining your business
  • Think about digital building blocks and APIs will follow
  • Outside-in beats inside-out every single time


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Good APIs Need Strong Partners
